intro: Shuteria suffulta var. sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese shuteria, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine.
